articles.title: Super Micro Computer, Inc. - Industry's First-to-Market Supermicro NVIDIA HGX™ B200 Systems Demonstrate AI Performance Leadership on MLPerf® Inference v5.0 Results
articles.summary: Super Micro Computer, Inc. announced leading performance on MLPerf Inference v5.0 benchmarks using their NVIDIA HGX B200 8-GPU systems, demonstrating over three times the token generation per second for Llama2-70B and Llama3.1-405B compared to previous generations. Both liquid-cooled and air-cooled systems achieved top results, showcasing Supermicro's innovation and collaboration with NVIDIA in AI workloads. The company's optimized systems were operational and available to customers before the benchmark start date, with results validated by MLCommons as reproducible.

articles.title: Twilio CEO Shipchandler sells stock worth over $1.15 million
articles.summary: Twilio Inc. CEO, Khozema Shipchandler, recently sold 12,056 shares of the company's Class A common stock for approximately $1.15 million, primarily to cover tax withholding obligations. Despite this sale, Shipchandler retains 295,134 shares, and Twilio's stock has seen strong performance with a 61% return over the past year. The company maintains a strong financial position, is considered slightly undervalued by InvestingPro, and has received positive outlooks from several analyst firms.

articles.title: Hyperscale Data completes Nvidia GPU cluster installation
articles.summary: Hyperscale Data has finished installing an Nvidia GPU cluster at its Michigan data center, intended for a new Silicon Valley-based cloud services provider. This move is part of the company's strategy to expand its infrastructure for growing computational demands, with plans to increase the Michigan data center's capacity from 28MW to 340MW. Hyperscale Data, formerly Ault Alliance, is pivoting entirely to AI and data centers, divesting non-data center assets.

articles.title: CXApp Inc. (Nasdaq:CXAI) Announces the Appointment of Terry Blanchard as Senior Vice President of Engineering
articles.summary: CXApp Inc. (Nasdaq:CXAI) has announced the appointment of Terry Blanchard as Senior Vice President of Engineering. Blanchard, with over 30 years of engineering leadership experience from companies like Apple, WhatsApp, and NVIDIA, will lead CXAI's global engineering organization and drive the development of next-generation AI technologies for workplace experiences. This strategic hire aims to accelerate CXAI's product roadmap and technical strategy, focusing on creating advanced Agentic AI solutions.

articles.title: SOXL stock: More chaos to come ahead of ‘Liberation Day’?
articles.summary: The Direxion Daily Semiconductor Bull 3X Shares (SOXL) ETF has notably declined due to macroeconomic uncertainties and anxiety over President Trump’s tariff agenda. Investors are monitoring April 2, dubbed "Liberation Day," for new tariff announcements that could further impact semiconductor demand, even if the sector avoids direct tariffs, particularly through collateral damage to chip-consuming industries like automotive. The future of the CHIPS Act also remains a wildcard, despite bipartisan support.

articles.title: CoreWeave Stock Treads Water After Scaled-Back IPO
articles.summary: CoreWeave, an AI-focused cloud computing company, had a lukewarm IPO, with its stock ending the day at its IPO price of $40 per share, despite initial stumbling. The scaled-back IPO and initial trading performance raise questions about investor appetite for AI stocks amidst a broader tech slump and concerns about CoreWeave's concentrated sales and significant debt. The company's debut is seen as a litmus test for the AI market after Nvidia's recent decline.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices Can Double in Price: Here’s Why
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is projected to double in price due to its increasing market share against NVIDIA in GPU and CPU markets, driven by lower-cost, better-performing products. Insider transactions, strong institutional buying, and an undervalued stock price relative to its growth potential support this optimistic outlook. The company is actively addressing its software infrastructure gap to further compete with NVIDIA.

articles.title: Qualcomm Stock Is Coiling for a Breakout
articles.summary: Qualcomm (NASDAQ: QCOM) is showing signs of an impending breakout, supported by robust technicals, an attractive valuation, and bullish analyst targets. The stock has consistently bounced off its key $150 support level, indicating strong buying interest after recent declines. With diversification efforts in automotive and AI chips paying off, Qualcomm offers significant value compared to its semiconductor peers.

articles.title: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai sells $5.15 million in company stock
articles.summary: Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai recently sold approximately $5.15 million in company stock through a pre-established trading plan. The sales occurred while Alphabet's stock traded near its 52-week low, though Wall Street maintains a bullish outlook. Pichai's remaining direct holdings in Alphabet amount to over 2.7 million shares.

articles.title: MongoDB CEO Dev Ittycheria sells $3.2 million in stock
articles.summary: MongoDB CEO Dev Ittycheria sold 18,512 shares of Class A common stock for approximately $3.2 million to cover tax withholding obligations. This transaction occurred amidst a 13% decline in MongoDB's stock price over the past week, though analysis suggests the stock is currently undervalued. Despite a recent strong Q4 performance, the company's FY26 guidance fell short, impacting its shares.

articles.title: USC Viterbi School Announces Keynote Speakers for 2025 Commencement Ceremonies
articles.summary: The USC Viterbi School of Engineering and USC School of Advanced Computing have announced their keynote speakers for the 2025 commencement ceremonies, scheduled for May 12-16, 2025. The speakers include NVIDIA executive Azita Martin, Axonics co-founder Guangqiang (Jay) Jiang, and AI pioneer Kevin Knight, who will address over 4,800 graduating engineering students across various undergraduate and master's ceremonies. These diverse speakers bring expertise from industry, entrepreneurship, and academia to inspire the graduating class.

articles.title: Spectral AI (MDAI) Secures $17.7 Million to Launch Burn Wound AI System
articles.summary: Spectral AI Inc. (MDAI) has secured $17.7 million in financing, including a $15 million debt facility and $2.7 million in equity, to accelerate the commercialization of its DeepView System. This AI-powered medical diagnostic tool aims to provide faster and more accurate wound care for burn patients. The company's goal is to launch the DeepView System in the U.S. market, improving patient outcomes and reducing healthcare costs.

articles.title: Game-Changing News for Advanced Micro Devices
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is integrating Rapt.AI into its MI300X, MI325X, and upcoming MI350 GPUs, which is expected to enhance its AI semiconductor capabilities and market share. The company also completed the acquisition of ZT Systems to offer end-to-end AI infrastructure solutions. Despite a recent stock price correction, analysts are still bullish on AMD, seeing it as a deep-value opportunity with significant growth catalysts.

articles.title: Abrdn Total Dynamic Dividend Fund Q4 2024 Commentary (AOD)
articles.summary: The abrdn Total Dynamic Dividend Fund (AOD) underperformed its benchmark in Q4 2024, primarily due to stock selection and sector allocation, with Tesla, Amazon, and Meta Platforms being key detractors. Despite global equity market gains driven by optimism over Trump's policies, the fund maintains a cautious outlook given macroeconomic factors and recession risks. The investment team focuses on stock-level diversification and capital preservation.

articles.title: SentinelOne CEO Tomer Weingarten sells $1.17 million in stock
articles.summary: SentinelOne (NYSE: S) CEO Tomer Weingarten recently sold 60,864 shares of the company's Class A common stock for approximately $1.17 million. This transaction was executed under a Rule 10b5-1 trading plan, leaving his direct ownership at 920,297 shares, despite also acquiring shares through conversions and exercised options without cash exchange. The sale comes amid varied analyst responses to SentinelOne's Q4 results and future guidance, leading to adjusted price targets from several firms.

articles.title: Is This the Best Artificial Intelligence ETF On the Market You Should Be Buying?
articles.summary: This article evaluates the Global X Artificial Intelligence & Technology ETF (AIQ) as a top investment option for gaining diversified exposure to the AI megatrend. It highlights AIQ's broad reach across the AI ecosystem, its 15.8% annualized return since 2018, and its holdings beyond just chip manufacturers to include software and data companies like ServiceNow and Snowflake. The ETF is presented as a calculated play on AI's future growth, offering opportunities with less individual stock risk.

articles.title: Accelerating Japan's growth with AI - Microsoft Stories Asia
articles.summary: Microsoft is making a significant $2.9 billion investment in Japan to expand its cloud infrastructure and boost AI capabilities by 2025, including the introduction of Azure High Performance Computing with NVIDIA GPUs. This initiative aims to accelerate Japan's AI transformation across various industries, enhance cybersecurity, and equip millions with AI skills through new programs like "CyberSmart AI" and partnerships with academic institutions. The investment underscores Microsoft's commitment to supporting Japan's economic growth and innovation in the AI era.

articles.title: 4 Best Leveraged ETFs of Last Week
articles.summary: Last week, the stock market saw moderate gains across major indices, driven by the Fed's decision to hold interest rates steady, NVIDIA's GTC event, and mixed retail sales data. Against this backdrop, several leveraged ETFs performed well, including those focused on energy, uranium, Brazilian stocks, and financials. These ETFs capitalized on the week's market movements, with MicroSectors Energy 3X Leveraged ETNs, Defiance Daily Target 2x Long Uranium ETF, ProShares Ultra MSCI Brazil Capped, and Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X Shares showing significant gains.
